action.action-desc: Mr. Veasey (for himself, Ms. Lee, Mr. Ellison, Ms. DelBene, and Mr. Grijalva) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to include guidance on how dependent students with parents without SSNs may obtain Federal student assistance.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the FAFSA for All Act.

section.header: FAFSA information for dependent students with parents without SSNs
section.text: Section 483(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1090(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Information for dependent students with parents without SSNs
subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall include on the same website used to provide students with the electronic version of the forms described in this paragraph the guidance described in paragraph (12)(B)(ii).
by striking The Secretary and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Dependent students with parents without SSNs
subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall include on the forms—

subclause.text: a dependent student meets the requirements of section 484(a)(5); and
the parents of a dependent student have a valid social security number; and

clause.text: in a case in which a dependent student meets the requirements of section 484(a)(5), but whose parents do not have a valid social security number, detailed guidance on how the student may obtain the Federal financial assistance described in paragraph (1), including an online tool that allows the student to upload documents required to receive such assistance.

section.text: The amendments made by section 1 shall be effective beginning academic year 2017–2018.
